DOCNAME: CASE OF SMIRNITSKAYA AND OTHERS v. RUSSIA
CONCLUSION: Preliminary objections dismissed;Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of P1-1;Pecuniary damage - financial award;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The first applicant was born in DATE , the second applicant was born in DATE and the third applicant was born in DATE . They live in GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicants receive old - age pensions . The PERSON of DATE on the Calculation and Upgrading of State Pensions ( “ the Pensions Act ” ) introduced , from CARDINAL DATE , a new method for calculating pensions . The idea behind this method , based on what is known as an “ individual pensioner coefficient ” , was to link the pension to the pensioner 's previous earnings .

CARDINAL . The authority in charge of the applicants ' pension , ORG of LOC ( “ the NORP ” ) , fixed the applicants ' coefficient at CARDINAL . The applicants challenged the ORG 's decision in the ORG . They argued that their coefficient should be TIME .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found for the applicants , considering that the ORG had misinterpreted LAW . In particular , it held as follows :

“ The opinion of [ the ORG ] ... is unfounded because DATE LAW ] specifically indicates that the individual pensioner coefficient ... is fixed at the rate of CARDINAL.CARDINAL . [ The ORG ] has no grounds to interpret this provision of the law arbitrarily or not to enforce it . ”
ORG decided that the ORG was to recalculate the applicants ' pensions using a coefficient of PERCENT from DATE .
CARDINAL . The ORG appealed against the judgment . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment , which became enforceable on DATE . The judgment was never executed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( “ the Ministry ” ) issued an Instruction on the “ Application of Limitations ” established by LAW ( “ the Instruction ” ) . The LAW clarified how to apply LAW .

CARDINAL . NORP Some time thereafter a group of individuals challenged the Instruction before ORG of GPE . On DATE ORG dismissed the complaint . It found that , contrary to what the complainants had suggested , ORG had not acted ultra vires in issuing the ORG , and that the ORG 's interpretation of LAW had been correct . On DATE ORG upheld this judgment on appeal .
CARDINAL . From DATE , following changes to the pension regulations , the first applicant 's pension was calculated based on a coefficient of CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG lodged an application with ORG for the reconsideration of the applicants ' case owing to newly discovered circumstances .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG examined the ORG 's request . It noted that the ORG had been upheld by ORG and held as follows :

“ As it can be seen from [ the ORG ] , the decision of ORG of DATE and the decision of ORG of DATE , the limiting coefficient of TIME , which was established by [ LAW ] , ... does not apply to [ an ' individual pensioner coefficient ' ] .
The existence of the interpretation [ of LAW ] by ORG constitutes a significant circumstance .

In accordance with ... Article CARDINAL of [ the ORG ] the ground for reconsideration of judgments ... on the basis of newly discovered circumstances shall be a significant circumstance which was not and could not have been known to a complainant . ...
Therefore there are grounds for reconsideration of the judgment of the district court of CARDINAL DATE owing to newly discovered circumstances . ”
The court noted that the ORG 's application was not time barred .
CARDINAL . In a decision of DATE ORG granted the ORG 's application , under LAW , and quashed the judgment of CARDINAL DATE , as upheld on DATE .

CARDINAL . As a result of the fresh examination of the case ORG delivered a judgment of DATE in which it relied on the ORG and rejected the applicants ' claims in full . The applicants appealed against the judgment .
CARDINAL . From DATE , following further changes to the pension regulations , the applicants ' coefficients were fixed at CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL respectively .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicants ' appeal and upheld the judgment of DATE .
CARDINAL . The Code of Civil Procedure of DATE ( “ CCivP ” ) , in force at the material time , provided as follows :
“ [ Judgments ] which have come into force may be reconsidered on the basis of newly discovered circumstances . The grounds for reconsideration ... shall be as follows :
CARDINAL . significant circumstances which were not and could not have been known to the party who applies for reconsideration ; ...
CARDINAL . cancellation of a court [ judgment ] or of another authority 's decision which served as legal basis for the [ judgment ] in question . ”
“ ... [ An application for reconsideration of a [ judgment ] owing to newly discovered circumstances ] shall be lodged within DATE after the discovery of the circumstances . ”

“ After examination of an application for reconsideration of a [ judgment ] owing to newly discovered circumstances , the court may either grant the application and quash the [ judgment ] , or dismiss the application .
The court decision by which an application for reconsideration of a [ judgment ] owing to newly discovered circumstances is granted shall not be subject to appeal . ... ”

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE adopted a ruling concerning certain provisions of LAW ( “ CCrP ” ) . In that ruling ORG decided that LAW CCrP ( “ FAC for reconsideration of a [ criminal ] case on the basis of newly discovered circumstances ” , which was in many respects similar to LAW was unconstitutional in that it limited the grounds for the reopening of a criminal case to situations of “ newly discovered circumstances ” . In that ruling ORG suggested that this provision of the ORG prevented rectification of judicial errors and miscarriages of justice . In its ruling of CARDINAL DATE ORG came to the conclusion that LAW was unconstitutional in so far as it had served as a basis for the dismissal of applications for reconsideration of judgments of the Presidium of ORG , where the judgment had been delivered as a result of a judicial error which had not been and could not have been established earlier .

CARDINAL . The Instruction of the Ministry of Labour and Social Development of DATE on the “ Application of Limitations ” established by LAW was registered by ORG on DATE and became binding in DATE , DATE after its official publication .
